com.tractrac.model.lib.api.event

Interface IRace

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<IRace>, IAttachable, IIdentifiable, IMetadataContainer, INamed, IPropertiesContainer, com.tractrac.util.lib.api.serialize.ISerializable

    public interface IRace
extends INamed, IMetadataContainer, com.tractrac.util.lib.api.serialize.ISerializable, java.lang.Comparable<IRace>

    Encapsulates data related to a specific Race of a TracTrac Event.

    A race has a unique id and a name. Furthermore it has a number of Race Competitors, one for each Competitor in the race, that is used to wrap Competitor data that may be different from Race to Race.

    Author:
    Jesper Grooss

      • getEvent

        Gets the event that contains the race
        Returns:
        the event that contains the race

      • getRaceCompetitors

        java.util.List<IRaceCompetitor> getRaceCompetitors()

        Returns the competitors that participate in this race.

        This method is thread-safety: it returns a copy of the list.

        Returns:
        the competitors that participate in this race.

      • getRaceCompetitor

        IRaceCompetitor getRaceCompetitor(java.util.UUID competitorId)
        Returns a race competitor by competitor id
        Parameters:
        competitorId - the competitor id
        Returns:
        the race competitor

      • getRaceStartTime

        long getRaceStartTime()

        Start time of race. Either the time where all competitors start, or where the first competitor start.

        If this value is 0L means that this value has not been established.

        Returns:
        Start time of race.

      • getRaceEndTime

        long getRaceEndTime()

        End time of race. Time when all competitors has finished competing.

        If this value is 0L means that this value has not been established.

        Returns:
        End time of race.

      • getTrackingStartTime

        long getTrackingStartTime()
        Start of tracking time can be set before start of race time in case it is interesting to follow what happens up til the start time of the race.

        It will either equal the start time of the race, or be shortly before the start time of the race.

        If this value is 0L means that the race has not been initialized: the positions that arrive to the server won't be attached to the race.

        Example: In sailing events it can be interesting to follow how the boats position them self up til the start time of the race.

        Returns:

      • getTrackingEndTime

        long getTrackingEndTime()

        End of tracking time when the trackers have stopped to send positions.

        If this value is 0L means that the race has not been initialized: the positions that arrive to the server won't be attached to the race.

        Returns:
        the tracking end time

      • getExpectedRaceStartDate

        long getExpectedRaceStartDate()

        It returns the expected date when the race starts. It always returns a datetime value with the time at 00:00:00.

        Returns:
        the estimated race start date

      • getRoutes

        java.util.List<IRoute> getRoutes()

        Gets the routes of this race

        This method is thread-safety: it returns a copy of the list.

        Returns:
        a list of routes

      • getDefaultRoute

        IRoute getDefaultRoute()
        Gets the default route
        Returns:
        a default route

      • getStatus

        RaceStatusType getStatus()
        Deprecated. use {@link IRace#getVisibility() instead
        Gets the status of the race that can be:
        • Hidden: the race is not visible
        • Offline: the race is visible but it is not accessible
        • Online: the race is visible and accessible (the replay status has been merged with this status)
        Returns:
        the status of the race

      • getVisibility

        RaceStatusType getVisibility()
        Gets the visibility of the race that can be:
        • Hidden: the race is not visible
        • Offline: the race is visible but it is not accessible
        • Online: the race is visible and accessible (the replay status has been merged with this status)
        Returns:
        the visibility of the race

      • getParameterSet

        com.tractrac.util.lib.api.programparameters.IParameterSet getParameterSet()
        Returns the parameters used to create this event.
        Returns:
        a set of parameters

      • getParamsURI

        java.net.URI getParamsURI()
        Gets the parameters file used to load this race
        Returns:
        the parameters file

      • getStoredURI

        java.net.URI getStoredURI()
        Gets the stored URI of this race. It can be used to download stored data of this race. It can be a connection to the database or a link to a MTB file
        Returns:
        the stored URI

      • getLiveURI

        java.net.URI getLiveURI()
        Gets the live URI of this race.
        Returns:
        the live URI

      • getRaceSerie

        IRaceSerie getRaceSerie()
        If the race is a part of a serie.
        Returns:
        the serie

        Add a new race competitor to the race

      • deleteRaceCompetitor

        Delete a race competitor from the race
        Parameters:
        competitorId - the competitor id

      • reloadFromServer

        void reloadFromServer()
                      throws RaceLoadingException
        This method is used to reload a race from the server using the parameters file
        Throws:
        RaceLoadingException - if there is an error loading the race

      • getLiveDelay

        int getLiveDelay()
        Returns the live delay in seconds. The live delay is the number of seconds that this race needs to be delayed when it is reproduced in live time. This value is retrieved from the parameters file. If this file has not been processed, this method returns -1.
        Returns:
        the live delay.

      • isInitialized

        boolean isInitialized()

        This value means if the race has been initialized. In practice, if this value returns false, the tracking start time and the tracking end time are null and there are not positions attached to this race.

        Returns:
        if the race has been initialized

      • getStartTimeType

        StartTimeType getStartTimeType()

        Gets the start time type of the race. At this moment this value is managed only at an event level but in a future this functionality will be added at a race level.

        If the attribute is not defined, it always returns StartTimeType.RaceStart

        Returns:
        the start time type
